@graph.caption: Close up of a plain scone with jam and cream being held up high, stacked on top of another scone.

@graph.name: Scones | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: Really easy, classic plain scones you'll make again and again. 3 ingredients, and in the oven in under 10 minutes! Soft and fluffy inside, serve with copious amounts of jam and cream for the ultimate classic afternoon experience.

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Scones
@graph.description: Recipe video above. Super quick and easy classic plain scone recipe, fluffy inside with golden tops. Using a food processor is not only easier, it eliminates common pitfalls when it comes to making scones. Serve with copious amounts of jam and cream!
recipeIngredient: 80 g / 3 oz  cold salted butter (, cut into 1 cm / 2/5" cubes (Note 2))

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour in food processor, then butter. Blitz on high for 8 seconds until it resembles breadcrumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Place flour in food processor, then butter. Blitz on high for 8 seconds until it resembles breadcrumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour milk all over the flour (don't pour in one place). Blitz for 6 to 8 seconds on high until the crumbs turn into ball(s).
recipeInstructions.name: Pour milk all over the flour (don't pour in one place). Blitz for 6 to 8 seconds on high until the crumbs turn into ball(s).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer dough onto work surface, scrape out residual bits in the food processor.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer dough onto work surface, scrape out residual bits in the food processor.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead lightly no more than 10 times just to bring the dough together into one smooth ball, then pat down into a 2 cm / 4/5" thick disc. Dust with extra flour if necessary (I don't need it).
recipeInstructions.name: Knead lightly no more than 10 times just to bring the dough together into one smooth ball, then pat down into a 2 cm / 4/5" thick disc. Dust with extra flour if necessary (I don't need it).

recipeInstructions.text: Optional: Lightly roll across the top with a rolling pin to smooth the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Optional: Lightly roll across the top with a rolling pin to smooth the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip a 5 cm / 2" round cutter into Extra Flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip a 5 cm / 2" round cutter into Extra Flour.

recipeInstructions.text: Plunge cutter straight down and back out into dough - do not twist. Repeat all over disc.
recipeInstructions.name: Plunge cutter straight down and back out into dough - do not twist. Repeat all over disc.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove excess dough from around scones, then carefully transfer scones onto baking tray, taking care not to smear / press the cut sides. (Note 4)
recipeInstructions.name: Remove excess dough from around scones, then carefully transfer scones onto baking tray, taking care not to smear / press the cut sides. (Note 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Gather together dough scraps and repeat. I get 10 scones in total.
recipeInstructions.name: Gather together dough scraps and repeat. I get 10 scones in total.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until the top is golden and it sounds hollow when tapped.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until the top is golden and it sounds hollow when tapped.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven, then transfer onto dish towel and wrap loosely (makes top soft).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven, then transfer onto dish towel and wrap loosely (makes top soft).

recipeInstructions.text: Once cooled to warm (10 - 15 minutes), serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Once cooled to warm (10 - 15 minutes), serve warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Tradition is to split the scone with hands (no knife!), slather with jam and dollop on cream.
recipeInstructions.name: Tradition is to split the scone with hands (no knife!), slather with jam and dollop on cream.

itemListElement.text: Whip cream, sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Makes 2 cups of whipped cream.
itemListElement.name: Whip cream, sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Makes 2 cups of whipped cream.
